roleset.name: surprise

example.name: active transitive verbal
example.text: BellSouth's revised proposal surprised many industry analysts, especially because of the company's willingness to accept some dilution of future earnings .
example.arg: especially because of the company's willingness to accept some dilution of future earnings

example.name: passivized verbal
example.text: That is why [everybody]-1 was a little surprised *trace*-1 by the storm of sell orders from small private investors,'' said Norbert Braeuer, a senior trader for Hessische Landesbank.
example.arg: by the storm of sell orders from small private investors

example.name: adjectival, sentential causer
example.text: ``Over the next couple of years we would not be surprised to see Europe and international sales represent 50% of the company's revenues,'' he said.
example.arg: to see Europe and international sales represent 50% of the company's revenues

example.name: adjectival, PP causer
example.text: Analysts, who were expecting Alcoa to post around $2.70 to $3 a share, were surprised at the lackluster third-quarter results.
example.arg: Analysts, who were expecting Alcoa to post around $2.70 to $3 a share,

example.name: with instrument
example.text: John surprised Mary with breakfast in bed on her birthday--it made quite a mess on her sheets, though.

roleset.note: Frames file for 'surprise' based on sentences in financial subcorpus, BOLT-1. Member of VNcls amuse-31.1
